result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Michael-Robert Sterling

records.addlTxt: No contact with SM or their residence.The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. The above no contact shall have the exception that the defendant may have a one time contact at the residence with Law Enforcement for property retrieval.

1:43 PM Defendant Brandon Michael-Robert Sterling appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Reid.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court requests alternate address-1612 N 13th St

State reviews criminal history/open files. Requests $750cb and no violent/abusive contact with V 1  1612 N 13 or SM
Court questions if there is an alternate address to the N 13th - 2201 John Ave
Attorney makes argument-livelong resident, family ties, was to start job in duluth.  Request sb or low cash bond.
Court cites concerns-Orders $600cb No contact with SM or their residence.The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. The above no contact shall have the exception that the defendant may have a one time contact at the residence with Law Enforcement for property retrieval.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
